text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Local long-term care ombudsman entity" means an entity designated by the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman to assist in carrying out the duties of the Program.

"Long-term care facility" means:
a nursing facility, as defined in § 19-301 of the Health - General Article; or
an assisted living program, as defined in § 19-1801 of the Health - General Article.
"Office" means the Office of the Long-Term Care Ombudsman established under this subtitle.

"Ombudsman" means:
the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman; and
any individual, whether a paid employee or a volunteer, who is designated by the State Long-Term Care Ombudsman as an ombudsman.
"Program" means the Long-Term Care Ombudsman Program established under this subtitle.
"Resident" means a resident of a long-term care facility located in the State.
"State Long-Term Care Ombudsman" means the individual selected by the Secretary under § 10-903 of this subtitle.
